C

checkGameStatus(int) - Method in class org.game.connect4.ConnectFourGame
Check the game status to determine if players have won/tied/or should continue
COMPUTER_VS_COMPUTER - Enum constant in enum class org.game.connect4.util.GameMode
Represents the mode in which two computers play against each other
ConnectFourGame - Class in org.game.connect4
ConnectFourGame contains the core logic of the ConnectFour game and all the functions required to play the game.
ConnectFourGame(GameGrid, GameMode, Player, Player) - Constructor for class org.game.connect4.ConnectFourGame
Constructs a ConnectFour game with gameGrid, gameMode, player1 and player2
ConnectFourInitializer - Class in org.game.connect4
ConnectFourInitializer provides different ways in which the ConnectFour game can be initialized.
ConnectFourInitializer() - Constructor for class org.game.connect4.ConnectFourInitializer
Constructs a default ConnectFourInitializer
ConnectFourStatus - Class in org.game.connect4.model
ConnectFourStatus indicates the status of the game after every move.
ConnectFourStatus(GameStatus) - Constructor for class org.game.connect4.model.ConnectFourStatus
Constructs ConnectFourStatus with a given gameStatus This should be used when gameStatus is either CONTINUE or TIE
ConnectFourStatus(GameStatus, List<GridPosition>) - Constructor for class org.game.connect4.model.ConnectFourStatus
Constructs ConnectFourStatus with a given gameStatus and winning sequence This should be used when either player has won the game
CONTINUE - Enum constant in enum class org.game.connect4.util.GameStatus
Represents the state when neither player has won or last; the game should continue
